text: Adkhamjon Ergashev (born ) is an Uzbekistani weightlifter competing in the 62 kg category until 2018, and the 61 kg and 67 kg categories starting in 2018 after the International Weightlifting Federation reorganized the categories.PDF listing of 2018 Group A world championship entrants in 61 kg ==Career== He competed at the 2014 and 2015 World Weightlifting Championships, and won bronze medals at the 2014 Summer Youth Olympics and 2018 Asian games. Ergashev also won the 62 kg division at the 2016 IWF Youth World Championship. At the 2018 World Weightlifting Championships he set 3 junior world records in the 61 kg class. At the 5th International Qatar Cup he competed in the 67 kg division,PDF listing of 5th Qatar Cup 2018 setting junior world records in the snatch and total. ==Major results== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center;" ! rowspan=2 width=40 | Year ! rowspan=2 width=275 | Venue ! rowspan=2 width=60 | Weight ! colspan=4 | Snatch (kg) ! colspan=4 | Clean & Jerk (kg) ! rowspan=2 width=60 | Total ! rowspan=2 width=40 | Rank |- ! width=60 | 1 ! width=60 | 2 ! width=60 | 3 ! width=45 | Rank ! width=60 | 1 ! width=60 | 2 ! width=60 | 3 ! width=45 | Rank |- ! colspan=13|Representing |- ! colspan=13|World Championships |- |2014 || align=left| Almaty, Kazakhstan || 62 kg || 108 || 111 || 114 || 31 || ~~127~~ || ~~127~~ || 127 || 31 || 241 || 27 |- |2015 || align=left| Houston, United States || 62 kg || 117 || 119 || 122 || 25 || 148 || 152 || 156 || 14 || 278 || 19 |- | 2017 || align=left| Anaheim, United States || 62 kg || ~~129~~ || 129 || 135 || || ~~157~~ || 157 || ~~164~~ || 8 || 292 || 4 |- | 2018 || align=left | Ashgabat, Turkmenistan || 61 kg || ~~132~~ || 133 || 136 || 4 || 157 || ~~160~~ || ~~166~~ || 10 || 293 || 6 |- | 2019 || align=left | Pattaya, Thailand || 67 kg || 143 || 146 || ~~151~~ || 4 || 173 || 179 || 182 || || 328 || 4 |- ! colspan=13|Asian Games |- |2018 || align=left| Jakarta, Indonesia || 62 kg || 128 || 133 || 136 || 2 || 158 || 162 || ~~165~~ || 4 || 298 || |- ! colspan=13|Qatar Cup |- |2018 || align=left| Doha, Qatar ||67 kg || 134 || 139 || 142 || || 163 || 168 || ~~171~~ || || 310 || |- |} ==References== Category:1999 births Category:Living people Category:Uzbekistani male weightlifters Category:Weightlifters at the 2014 Summer Youth Olympics Category:Asian Games medalists in weightlifting Category:Asian Games bronze medalists for Uzbekistan Category:Weightlifters at the 2018 Asian Games Category:Medalists at the 2018 Asian Games
